ref: 3222 *kujjati ʻ rots ʼ. [Perh. < *kūryatē < *k˚rə -- ye -- = kīryatē with same semantic development, or < *k˚ru -- ye -- beside kṛṇōti ʻ hurts ʼ Dhātup., Pa. karati ʻ cuts, hurts ʼ]
H. kujnā ʻ to moulder away, rot, ferment, become old ʼ;
M. kuj̈ṇẽ ʻ to lose cohesion of parts, rot, putrefy, (in games) lie out of play ʼ, kuj̈aviṇẽ ʻ to make rot ʼ, kuj̈ḍā ʻ rotten ʼ. -- See kīryatē.
